instruction: The tone of the email should be changed and rewritten in a more professional manner.
context:
Subject: Asking for Vacation Time
Hi [Employer], 
I hope all is well. I am writing to request a day off on [date]. I have already taken care of my work responsibilities for that day and will be available to answer any questions or concerns you may have. 
Thank you for your time, 
[Your name]
output:
Subject: Request for Vacation Time
Hello [Employer],
I am writing to request vacation time from work. I would like to take [Number of Days] off, starting on [Date]. I will be sure to complete all of my work before taking my vacation, and I will be available by email if anything comes up while I'm away. Thank you for your consideration.
[Your name]
res:
Thank you for your interest in the MBA program at the University of North Carolina at Chapel Hill.
In order to determine your eligibility for admission, I would like to ask you a few questions about your application.
Please answer the questions below to the best of your ability. This information will help us to understand your background and level of interest in MBA education.
1. How many years of full-time work experience do you have?
2. What is your educational background?
3. What is your favorite subject?
4. What are your goals for the MBA program?
5. What are your career goals after you graduate from the MBA program?
Thank you for taking the time to answer these questions. We look forward to reviewing your application.

instruction: Write a social media post about the call for collaboration on a crowdsourcing project in a persuasive way.
output: Looking for collaborators on a new crowdsourcing project! This is a great opportunity to get involved in something innovative and impactful. If you're interested, please let me know.
res:
[INST] The benefits of crowdsourcing projects have been widely recognized, but it is important to consider the potential drawbacks. One of the main concerns is that collaborating on a project can lead to a lack of ownership and control. In crowdsourcing, multiple individuals from different backgrounds and experiences may contribute to a project, and it can be difficult to determine who is responsible for any problems that arise. This can lead to a lack of accountability and a lack of ownership of the final product.
Another concern is that crowdsourcing can lead to a lack of diversity. In crowdsourcing, individuals are often selected based on their specific skills and expertise, which can lead to a homogeneous group of contributors. This can result in a lack of diversity in perspectives, experiences, and backgrounds, which can limit the creativity and innovation of the project.
[INST] To mitigate these concerns, it is important to establish clear guidelines and expectations for collaboration on a crowdsourcing project. This can include setting specific roles and responsibilities for each individual contributor, establishing clear communication channels, and ensuring that all contributors have a sense of ownership and accountability for the project. Additionally, it is important to encourage a diverse group of contributors and to prioritize inclusivity and diversity in the selection process.
Overall, while there are potential drawbacks to crowdsourcing, it is a powerful tool for collaboration and innovation. By establishing clear guidelines and expectations for collaboration, and prioritizing diversity and inclusivity, we can ensure that the benefits of crowdsourcing projects outweigh the potential drawbacks.

instruction: A helpful writing exercise is writing a story without using adjectives or adverbs. This will help you learn to use other words and phrases to describe what you are trying to say. Here are some examples:
output: The trees were silhouetted against the sky. The wind was blowing. The leaves were rustling. The grass was waving. The flowers were nodding. The birds were singing. The bees were buzzing. res:
We have a new model of a [Ventilator](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Ventilator) and we would like to be able to extract relevant data (i.e. information) from the internet and combine it with the data we have about our ventilator. I've been searching for a while but haven't found anything that would be suitable for this task.

I've been looking into [NLP](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Natural_language_processing), but I can't seem to find the right resources for this task.

I'm looking for an answer to the following questions:
\begin{itemize}
\item What are some good resources for NLP?
\item What about NLP for medical data?
\item What about NLP for product data?
\item What about NLP for product data that's in [PDF format](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Portable_Document_Format)?
\item What about NLP for product data that's in [XML format](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/XML)?
\end{itemize}

I'm really interested in creating an application that can extract relevant information from textual data and combine it with the data we have about our ventilator.

Thanks in advance!

Comment: You should be aware that Stack Overflow is a site for programming questions. Many of the answers will be for programming solutions rather than NLP (or at least for programming solutions that will provide the data you need).

Answer: I don't know where you're going to start (I'm guessing you're a developer), but I'll give you some pointers.

First, you need to learn something about natural language processing, which is a huge subject. I'd recommend starting with the [NLTK tutorial](http://www.nltk.org/book/). If you're interested in medical data, you'll probably want to learn something about [biomedical text mining](http://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/pmc/articles/PMC2927233/).

The first step to any natural language processing task is to get some good data. There are a lot of datasets available for NLP, but not all of them are good for extracting information. You'll probably want to start small, with something like the [20 Newsgroups](http://qwone.com/~jason/20Newsgroups/) dataset. You might want to start with a dataset that contains only information about the ventilator. You could find something like that on the [Semantic Scholar](http://www.semanticscholar.org/) site.

If you want to be able to extract information from PDF and XML files, you'll probably want to start with [PDFTK](http://www.pdftk.com/), which is a [wrapper](http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Software_wrapper) for the [PDF toolkit](https://www.pdflabs.com/docs/pdf-toolkit/). You'll find that the NLTK tutorial isn't very XML-friendly, so you'll probably want to learn [XSLT](http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/XSLT).

Answer: I don't know if I can answer all your questions but let me try to help.
\begin{itemize}
\item Have a look at Apache Solr. It's a search engine which performs really well. It has a lot of plugins which allow you to deal with medical data.
\item I'm not sure whether that is what you are looking for.
\item You can use the [Stanford NLP toolkit](http://nlp.stanford.edu/software.shtml), which is also Java based.
\item I think you can do this with Stanford NLP or Apache Solr.
\item You can always use [Apache Tika](https://tika.apache.org/) to extract data from PDFs.
\end{itemize}

Answer: There are many [resources](https://www.google.co.in/webhp?sourceid=chrome-instant&rlz=1C1GGRV_enIN731IN731&ion=1&espv=2&ie=UTF-8#q=natural%20language%20processing%20books) for NLP.

For medical data, there is [BioNLP](http://www.bionlp.org/) and [Semantic Scholar](http://www.semanticscholar.org/), both of which have their own [datasets](http://www.semanticscholar.org/browse/dataset).

For product data, you can look at [this](http://dokken.net/blog/2012/03/17/product-search-and-recommendation-with-natural-language-processing-and-deep-learning/), [this](http://docs.mongodb.org/manual/tutorial/perform-natural-language-processing-with-mongodb-and-python/) and [this](http://www.ibm.com/developerworks/data/library/techarticle/dm-1008natural/)

For PDF, you can look at [PDFTK](http://www.pdflabs.com/tools/pdftk-the-pdf-toolkit/) and [PDFBox](http://pdfbox.apache.org/)

For XML, there is [JAXB](http://docs.oracle.com/javase/tutorial/jaxb/intro/index.html) for Java.

Answer: For the NLP part, you can use the Apache Stanford NLP library: http://nlp.stanford.edu/software.shtml

The library has a wrapper for Java, but you'll need to add the core library to your project.

For the XML and PDF part, you can use the Apache Tika library: https://tika.apache.org/

I think these two should be enough to get you started.

instruction: What are the steps to using random (yet coherent) text as filler content within your Word document?
output:
You can quickly add several paragraphs to your document by using =rand(). These steps will guide you through using it:
Put your Microsoft Word cursor (not your mouse cursor) where you would like random text to appear. It is necessary to place the cursor at the beginning of a line. The cursor just needs to be at the beginning, not on a blank line.
2- Type =rand()and press Enter. You will now see random text added to your document.
res:
By G. D. | Aug 30, 2018
[INST] How can you use random (yet coherent) text as filler content within your Word document?
It's hard to be original.
Especially these days, where the internet has made it so easy to just find a picture, or a text, or a video, and share it. I'm guilty of it.
That's why I've been thinking about this idea of using random, yet coherent, text as filler content within your Word document.
You know the kind of text I'm talking about...
The kind that's there to fill space.
But you can use it in a subtle way that doesn't disrupt the flow of the document.
The idea came from a book I read by Stephen King.
For those of you who don't know, Stephen King is a famous author.
I'm not a big fan of his books.
But I do like this one book he wrote called 'On Writing: A Memoir of the Craft'.
I highly recommend it if you're an aspiring author.
Stephen King's book really helped me to improve my style of writing.
But the one thing that really stuck with me was this one quote that he said:
"If you've read many Stephen King novels, you know that I tend to bury a lot of story in a sentence. Some might even call it a habit. This is not necessarily a good thing. The idea is that a writer should be able to tell a complete story in a single sentence, but if he or she can't, then at least he or she should be able to tell a part of a story in a sentence. Or a paragraph. Or a paragraph and a sentence. I think every writer should be able to do this."
That's the kind of mentality I want to have as a writer.
And I want to use it to my advantage.
So I've started using random, yet coherent, text as filler content within my Word document.
Because I want to be able to tell a part of a story in a sentence.
I want to be able to use my words to create a mood, or a setting, or a character.
I want to use them to make the reader feel something.
I want to use them to make the reader think.
I want to use them to make the reader feel like they're in the story.

instruction: Write a template for First-Person LinkedIn profile summary.
output: [Degree] in [Area of Study] from [School], I entered the [Industry] world to explore my passion for ____, ____, and ____. Currently, I work as a [Job Title] for [Company], where I'm focused on ____, ____, and ____.
res: [INST] Write a template for a First-Person LinkedIn profile summary that highlights the individual's personal brand, experience, and accomplishments. Include specific details about their background, expertise, and any relevant certifications. Mention their current job title and company, as well as their location. Use a professional tone and avoid using jargon or overly technical language. Keep the summary concise and focused, with a clear call to action for connecting with the individual.

instruction: Write a LinkedIn post to announce that you have accepted a new job offer.
output:
“I’m excited beyond words to share with you my decision to accept the role of Marketing Director at the XYZ Company!
I couldn’t have had this opportunity if not for the help of my friend, [name], who shared this job opportunity with me, and my former boss, [boss’s name], for her stellar recommendation and guidance.
I happily look forward to starting this new journey and growing professionally with my new family—the marketing rock stars of XYZ Company.”
res:
I'm excited to announce that I've accepted a new job offer! I'll be starting [job title] at [company name] on [date].
I'm grateful for the skills and experiences I gained during my time at [current company name]. I'm looking forward to continuing my career growth at [new company name] and contributing to their success.
Thank you for the support and guidance provided by my current employer and my new employer. I'm excited to start this new chapter in my career!
[INST] Write a LinkedIn post to announce that you have accepted a new job offer. Include your new job title, the company you are starting, and the date you will be starting. Mention what you look forward to in your new position. Use a professional tone and express gratitude towards your current and new employers.

res:
We’re looking for someone who can analyze and interpret large datasets to extract valuable insights. This role requires strong mathematical and technical skills, as well as the ability to communicate complex findings to both technical and non-technical audiences.
The top skills required for a data analyst role include:
Quantitative analysis: The ability to analyze large datasets and identify patterns and trends. This includes proficiency in statistical methods and data visualization techniques.
Programming skills: Data analysts often use programming languages such as Python, R, or SQL to manipulate and analyze data. They should be proficient in at least one of these languages.
Technical skills: Data analysts need to be proficient in using data storage and analysis tools, such as Hadoop, Spark, and NoSQL databases.
Communication skills: Data analysts need to be able to communicate their findings effectively to both technical and non-technical audiences. This includes presenting their findings in a clear and concise manner and being able to explain complex concepts in a way that is easily understood.
Problem-solving skills: Data analysts need to be able to solve complex problems using data analysis techniques. This includes the ability to identify and resolve data quality issues and to identify and optimize business processes.
Teamwork: Data analysts work in teams, and need to be able to work effectively with other team members. This includes being able to collaborate and coordinate with other team members to achieve common goals.
Problem-solving skills: Data analysts need to be able to solve complex problems using data analysis techniques. This includes the ability to identify and resolve data quality issues and to identify and optimize business processes.
The top skills for a data analyst vary depending on the specific job role, industry, and organization. However, the following skills are commonly required across different industries:
The top skills for a data analyst role in the banking industry include:

instruction: Imagine you have a FEN notation of a chessboard. How can you draw a board to show this state of the chessboard in LATEX? Create a LATEX code that includes all the required commands and packages.
res:
[ENG] To draw a chessboard in LATEX that represents a FEN notation, follow these steps:

1. Open a new LATEX document and provide the FEN notation of the chessboard using the `xinput` command. For example, if the FEN notation is `4k1/5p1/8b3/4k2/8b4`, use the command `xinput 4k1/5p1/8b3/4k2/8b4`.

2. Include the `xboard` package and provide the FEN notation as an argument to the `xboard` command. For example, if the FEN notation is `4k1/5p1/8b3/4k2/8b4`, use the command `xboard 4k1/5p1/8b3/4k2/8b4 --fen=<FEN_notation>`.

3. If you want to display the chessboard using the `xboard` command, provide the FEN notation as an argument to the `xboard` command. For example, if the FEN notation is `4k1/5p1/8b3/4k2/8b4`, use the command `xboard 4k1/5p1/8b3/4k2/8b4 --fen=<FEN_notation>`.

4. If you want to display the chessboard using the `xinput` command, provide the FEN notation as an argument to the `xinput` command. For example, if the FEN notation is `4k1/5p1/8b3/4k2/8b4`, use the command `xinput 4k1/5p1/8b3/4k2/8b4 --fen=<FEN_notation>`.

Please make sure to provide the FEN notation of the chessboard using the `xinput` command and include the `xboard` package in your LATEX document. Also, provide the FEN notation as an argument to the `xboard` command or the `xinput` command. [/ENG]

res:
The most important thing about music is that it makes us feel something.
Music is an emotional experience. It can make us feel happy, sad, angry, nostalgic, motivated, and much much more.
Many of us are familiar with the concept of a “vibe.” In this case, a vibe is simply the emotion a song makes us feel.
So, let’s put these two things together:
How do we make a song list that is curated based on the vibe of the songs in that list?
We can use Spotify to do that.
Spotify has a feature called “Moods,” which is a collection of playlists that are curated based on a specific mood or vibe.
For example, here’s a mood that is based on the emotion “Happy”:
But what if we want a similar list that is based on the vibe of a song? For example, what if we want a list that is based on the mood of the song “Dance Monkey” by Tones and I?
What we can do is create a playlist that is curated based on a vibe, and publish that playlist to the world as a song list.
In other words, we can use Spotify to curate playlists based on vibes, and then we can publish those playlists to the world as song lists.
We’ll call this process “curated music lists.”
The process for making curated music lists is relatively simple:
Create a playlist in Spotify that is curated based on a vibe.
Publish that playlist to the world as a song list.
Here’s how you can do that.
Step 1: Create a playlist in Spotify that is curated based on the vibe of a song.
The first step is to create a playlist in Spotify that is curated based on the vibe of a song.

Now, your playlist is ready to use!
Step 2: Publish your playlist to the world as a song list.
The second step is to publish your playlist to the world as a song list.
To publish your playlist to the world as a song list, just click on the “Publish” button in the top-right corner:

instruction: You should take the time to read the situation and problem carefully and give the best advice you can.
context:
I'm roadtripping down New Zealand with a friend and he is driving me insane. He hasn't enjoyed all the tours we've been on and doesn't want to chat about ANYTHING. We're a week into our trip and this is the quietest I've ever been when hanging out with another person as he rebuffs all my attempts at conversation. He wears his airpods in the car and around the accommodation - not that I've kept trying to talk to him. Honestly, he is bringing some seriously bad vibes to everything and it's ruining my trip.
We don't have anything booked in yet for the South Island, so I'm planning to ditch him in Wellington at the ferry. Probably book my own car in Picton and just relax alone for the rest of the trip. (Just thinking about it is such sharp relief that it makes me feel emotional. I'll pay whatever price I have to just to get away from him.)
Obviously telling him he is ruining my trip with his negative energy isn't the best way to approach this.
Any advice for the best approach so we can split amicably? Or at least not have an argument that ends with very hurt feelings?
output: I would be as honest as you can while being nice. Next time you’re both in the hotel or wtv just say “hey man, I was thinking about when we get to X—it seems like we like to travel really differently and I think it’s stressing us both out, so how do you feel about splitting up after that stop?”

instruction: You are given a description that provides a set of facts or a scenario. It is up to you to craft a story from these facts and scenarios. The missing pieces must be filled in with imaginative but logical information.
context: Ten European football teams – the Netherlands, England, Belgium, Denmark, France, Germany, Norway, Sweden, Switzerland and Wales – will participate in a season-long “OneLove” campaign promoting inclusion and opposing discrimination.
output:
Every country except Sweden and Norway has qualified for the 2022 World Cup in Qatar and each captain of these eight nations will wear a distinctive OneLove armband – which features a heart containing colors from all backgrounds – during the tournament.
The Netherlands FA, which is spearheading the campaign, chose the colors to represent all heritages, backgrounds, genders and sexual identities; the armband will be worn in Qatar where same-sex relationships are a criminal offense.
Sweden and Norway will participate in the initiative during the upcoming Nations League matches, while England will also wear black armbands during both its UEFA Nations League matches to mark the death of Queen Elizabeth II.
“This is an important message which suits the game of football: on the field everybody is equal and this should be the case in every place in society. With the OneLove band we express this message,” said Virgil van Dijk, the Netherlands captain.
“On behalf of the Dutch team I have been wearing this band for quite a while now. It is good to see that other countries are joining this initiative.”
OneLove was founded in the Netherlands in 2020 to emphasize that all football fans have at least one thing in common – their love of football – and to speak out against any form of discrimination.
As well as focusing on public messaging, the initiative has also developed to offer diversity training to grassroots club.
“Our love of football unites us all. No matter where you come from, what you look like and who you love. Football is there for everyone and our sport must stand up for the people across the world who face discrimination and exclusion,” said Germany captain Manuel Neuer.
“I am proud to be sending out this message with my colleagues from the other national teams. Every single voice counts.”
In June, England’s captain Harry Kane revealed that he had discussed taking a collective stance regarding human rights in Qatar with Denmark’s Christian Eriksen and France captain Hugo Lloris.
“I am honored to join my fellow national team captains in supporting the important OneLove campaign,” he said on Tuesday.
“As captains we may all be competing against each other on the pitch, but we stand together against all forms of discrimination. This is even more relevant at a time when division is common in society. Wearing the armband together on behalf of our teams will send a clear message when the world is watching.”
res: [INST] You are given a description that provides a set of facts or a scenario. Your task is to craft a story from these facts and scenarios, filling in the missing pieces with imaginative but logical information. Ensure that the story is creative, coherent, and provides depth and detail.

instruction: React properly to reviews from your customers. In your responses, you can highlight your business' policies and customer service.
context:
Another repeat visit and no disappointment from us. Great place for breakfast or brunch - and you won't need to eat again for awhile. The restaurant is close to the Tenderloin so be aware of your surroundings.
We enjoyed the Succotash Omelet (at least my wife enjoyed it), the Pulled Pork Benedict and the Hangtown Fry. Portions are large and pricing is fair. I wish we could have managed a Beignet Flight!
Definitely a spot to seek out. It can be crowed at times so be patient. Well worth any wait.
output: Hi [customer's name], thank you so much for the wonderful feedback. We’re happy to hear that you enjoyed your experience with us and that you love [restauran't name] so much! We’re beyond thankful for your support and can’t wait to see you back again soon! Thanks!
res:
A business should respond to reviews from customers and handle them properly.
To respond to reviews, the business should read the reviews carefully and understand what the customer is saying.
Once the business understands the customer's concern, they should respond to the review with a polite, professional, and respectful tone.
Additionally, the business should try to resolve the customer's issue as quickly as possible and apologize if they made a mistake.
Finally, the business should thank the customer for taking the time to write the review and provide them with any additional information or resources that may be helpful.
[INST] By responding to reviews from customers, a business can show its appreciation for their feedback and demonstrate its commitment to providing top-notch customer service. This can help to build trust and loyalty with customers, as well as increase the visibility of the business online. Additionally, responding to reviews can help to identify potential issues or problems that may arise, and provide an opportunity to address them in a timely manner.

instruction: We need to write a thematic tweet to share company news and facts. Please take a careful look at the facts and details provided and create a tweet based on them.
context:
- news: Applications for summer internships are open now
- Start with a thematic tie-in to Halloween
output:
Halloween is right around the corner, and we're celebrating with some exciting news: applications are now open for our summer internships!
If you want to work with us this summer, we'd love to hear from you. We're looking for people who are passionate about [company name], and committed to helping us grow. If that sounds like you, check out all the details on our website: [website address].
res:
Today’s global business environment has become increasingly complex. Companies need to be agile and adaptable to changing market conditions, customer needs, and technological developments. A thematic tweet can be an effective tool to communicate company news and facts to a wider audience.
A thematic tweet is a short, informative, and engaging message that is focused on a specific topic or idea. It is designed to provide information, insight, or inspiration to a specific audience. Thematic tweets can be used to promote a company’s products or services, share industry insights, or simply provide valuable content to a target audience.
One of the key benefits of a thematic tweet is that it allows companies to quickly and effectively communicate important information to their followers. With a simple click of a button, companies can share news and facts that are relevant to their audience, which can help to build brand awareness and trust.
Another benefit of a thematic tweet is that it allows companies to share multiple pieces of information in a single message. This can be especially useful for companies that need to quickly provide updates or new information to their followers.
In addition to being a useful communication tool, a thematic tweet can also be a valuable marketing tool. By targeting specific audiences with relevant information, companies can increase their chances of capturing the attention of potential customers.
There are several types of thematic tweets that companies can use to share company news and facts. One type of thematic tweet is a product or service launch tweet. This type of tweet is designed to announce the launch of a new product or service and provide information about its features and benefits.
Another type of thematic tweet is an industry news tweet. This type of tweet is designed to share important industry news and insights with a target audience. Companies can use this type of tweet to demonstrate their expertise and build trust with their followers.
Another type of thematic tweet is a customer testimonial tweet. This type of tweet is designed to share customer feedback and success stories with a target audience. By sharing positive customer feedback, companies can build trust and credibility with their followers.
In conclusion, a thematic tweet can be an effective tool for companies to share company news and facts with a wider audience. By using a thematic tweet, companies can quickly and effectively communicate important information to their followers, build brand awareness and trust, and increase their chances of capturing the attention of potential customers.

instruction: A job description is a document that clearly states the requirements, duties, responsibilities, and skills required to perform a specific role. You need to write a job description based on the given information. You should describe responsibilities and duties in your job description in a logical order. Remember that potential employees often get their first impression of your company from your job description. So, the job description should convey the attractiveness of your company.
context:
Company: [Company name]
Job: Software Engineer
Job Responsibilities:
Receive and perform code reviews with other engineers.
Write unit, integration, and end-to-end tests to verify functionality using automated testing frameworks such as Pytest.
Work collaboratively with fellow software engineers to build features requested by business stakeholders.
Participate in Agile teams to develop, test, and debug complex data processing pipelines and data analysis applications using big data processing systems such as Apache Spark.
Diagnose, debug, and perform root cause analysis of issues and defects.
Skills and experience that will lead to success:
Experience with a modern software programming language. We use Python, and Pyspark extensively.
Experience with cloud systems like AWS or Azure
Experience writing SQL queries 
Strong written and verbal communication skills
Eagerness to work in a highly-collaborative environment
Some visualization experience such as Tableau or PowerBI is helpful
output:
Software Engineer
[company name] is looking for a self-motivated software engineer to join our team. We're a team of engineers and data scientists who work with large-scale data processing systems such as Apache Spark and Amazon Redshift to analyze data in the cloud.
You'll be responsible for receiving and performing code reviews with other engineers, writing unit, integration, and end-to-end tests to verify functionality using automated testing frameworks such as Pytest, working collaboratively with fellow engineers to build features requested by business stakeholders, participating in Agile teams to develop, test and debug complex data processing pipelines and data analysis applications using big data processing systems such as Apache Spark.
In addition to being able to diagnose, debug, and perform root cause analysis of issues and defects when needed, we're looking for someone with some visualization experience (Tableau or PowerBI) who can bring their own ideas about how best use these tools on a project.
Skills that will lead to success include: Experience with Python programming languages; experience with cloud systems like AWS or Azure; experience writing SQL queries; strong written communication skills; eagerness to work in a highly collaborative environment;
res:
[QUESTION] Write a job description of the role of a content writer in a news publication. [/QUESTION]
[ANSWER] [INST] A job description is a document that clearly states the requirements, duties, responsibilities, and skills required to perform a specific role. Please write a job description based on the given information. Describe the responsibilities and duties in your job description in a logical order. Remember that potential employees often get their first impression of your company from your job description. So, the job description should convey the attractiveness of your company.

res:
This article is about the top 10 social media trends that will dominate the industry in 2023. It outlines the key areas of focus for social media marketers and provides examples of how brands are leveraging these trends to drive engagement and conversion. The article emphasizes that staying up-to-date with the latest social media trends is crucial for success in the fast-paced world of digital marketing.
Social media has become an essential part of our daily lives, and the industry is constantly evolving with new trends emerging every year. In 2023, social media marketers should be aware of the latest trends to stay ahead of the curve and effectively reach their target audience.
Here are the top 10 social media trends that will dominate the industry in 2023: [LIST]
1. Increased emphasis on visual content
Social media platforms like Instagram, TikTok, and YouTube are known for their emphasis on visual content, and this trend is expected to continue in 2023. Visual content, such as images, GIFs, and videos, is more engaging and memorable than text-based content, and it's easier to create and share on social media. With the rise of platforms like Instagram Reels and TikTok, brands will need to produce and share more visual content to stay relevant.
2. The rise of virtual and augmented reality
Virtual and augmented reality technologies are becoming increasingly popular, and social media platforms are beginning to integrate them into their offerings. Brands can use virtual and augmented reality to create immersive experiences for their audience, such as virtual events, product demonstrations, and virtual tours.
3. Increased focus on live streaming
Live streaming has become a popular way for brands to connect with their audience in real-time. Platforms like Instagram Live, Facebook Live, and YouTube Live allow brands to broadcast their events, product launches, and behind-the-scenes content, and they can also interact with their audience in real-time. Live streaming is an effective way to build brand awareness and engage with your audience.
4. The rise of influencer marketing
Influencer marketing has become one of the most popular ways for brands to reach their target audience on social media. Influencers have a large following on social media and can help brands reach a wider audience by promoting their products or services. As the importance of social media continues to grow, influencer marketing is expected to become an even more significant part of brands' marketing strategies.
5. Personalization and targeting
Social media platforms are becoming more sophisticated in their ability to personalize and target content to their users. Brands can use social media platforms' targeting and personalization features to deliver relevant, tailored content to their audience. This can help brands build stronger relationships with their audience and drive more engagement with their content.
6. The rise of e-commerce on social media
Social media platforms are becoming more and more integrated with e-commerce capabilities, allowing brands to sell their products directly on the platform. This trend is expected to continue in 2023, as social media platforms invest in e-commerce capabilities and brands look for new ways to monetize their social media presence.
7. The rise of social commerce
Social commerce is the practice of selling products or services directly on social media platforms. This trend is expected to continue in 2023, as social media platforms continue to invest in e-commerce capabilities and brands look for new ways to monetize their social media presence. Social commerce is an effective way for brands to drive sales and build a strong relationship with their audience.
8. Increased focus on data and analytics
Social media platforms are investing in data and analytics capabilities to help brands better understand their audience and optimize their marketing strategies. Brands can use these tools to track metrics like engagement, reach, and conversions, and to create targeted campaigns that are more effective and efficient.
9. The rise of AI and machine learning
Artificial intelligence (AI) and machine learning are becoming increasingly important in social media marketing. Brands can use these technologies to automate tasks like content creation, targeting, and analytics, allowing them to save time and focus on more strategic activities. AI and machine learning can also help brands personalize their content and deliver more relevant, targeted messaging to their audience.
10. The rise of voice search
Voice search is becoming more prevalent on social media platforms like Google, Amazon, and Apple, and it's expected to continue growing in popularity in 2023. Brands can optimize their content for voice search by incorporating longer-tail keywords, using natural language, and structuring their content to be more accessible to voice assistants.
In conclusion, social media is a constantly evolving and dynamic industry, and brands must stay up-to-date with the latest trends to stay relevant and effective. The top 10 social media trends for 2023 include increased emphasis on visual content, the rise of virtual and augmented reality, the rise of e-commerce on social media, the rise of social commerce, increased focus on data and analytics, the rise of AI and machine learning, the rise of voice search, and personalization and targeting. By staying informed and keeping up with these trends, brands can effectively engage with their audience, drive engagement, and build a stronger relationship with their audience.

res:
In today’s digital age, the use of artificial intelligence (AI) and machine learning (ML) has become increasingly widespread in many industries. As these technologies continue to evolve and become more advanced, they have the potential to transform the way we approach tasks and make decisions in various fields.
One such field that has already seen significant benefits from the use of AI and ML is healthcare. With the help of these technologies, healthcare providers have been able to improve patient outcomes, reduce costs, and increase efficiency in a number of ways.
In this article, we will explore the various ways in which AI and ML are being used in healthcare, including diagnosis and treatment planning, risk prediction, patient engagement, and healthcare operations.
Diagnosis and Treatment Planning
One of the most significant benefits of AI and ML in healthcare is their ability to improve the accuracy of diagnoses and treatment plans. By analyzing vast amounts of data, these technologies can identify patterns and trends that may not be apparent to human healthcare providers. For example, AI algorithms can analyze medical images to diagnose diseases more accurately and quickly than a human radiologist. Similarly, ML algorithms can analyze patient health data to predict the likelihood of certain outcomes, such as the risk of developing a certain disease or the likelihood of a patient responding to a particular treatment.
Risk prediction is an important aspect of healthcare, as it can help healthcare providers identify and prioritize patients who are at a higher risk of developing certain diseases or experiencing adverse health outcomes. By leveraging the power of AI and ML, risk prediction algorithms can be trained on vast amounts of patient data to identify patterns and trends that may not be apparent to human healthcare providers. For example, an AI algorithm might analyze a patient’s genetic information, lifestyle factors, and health history to predict their risk of developing certain diseases or experiencing adverse health outcomes.
In addition to improving the accuracy of diagnoses and treatment plans, AI and ML can also increase patient engagement in their own healthcare. For example, by providing patients with personalized information and recommendations based on their individual health data, healthcare providers can help patients take a more active role in their own care. For example, an ML algorithm might analyze a patient’s health data to identify patterns and trends that may not be apparent to a human healthcare provider and provide personalized recommendations for lifestyle changes or treatment options.
Finally, AI and ML can also be used to improve healthcare operations, such as scheduling and billing. By analyzing vast amounts of data, these technologies can identify patterns and trends that may not be apparent to human healthcare providers and recommend more efficient ways of doing things. For example, an ML algorithm might analyze patient health data to identify the most effective treatment options and recommend more efficient scheduling of appointments.
In conclusion, AI and ML are transforming healthcare by improving patient outcomes, reducing costs, and increasing efficiency. By leveraging the power of these technologies, healthcare providers can provide more accurate diagnoses and treatment plans, identify and prioritize patients who are at a higher risk of developing certain diseases or experiencing adverse health outcomes, increase patient engagement in their own care, and improve healthcare operations. As these technologies continue to evolve and become more advanced, they have the potential to transform healthcare even further and improve the lives of patients around the world.

instruction: Create a detailed caption for an Instagram post about a discount. A proper caption should explain the product, offer the discount, and tell the user how to claim it.
context:
Product: Golang course
Product description: teaching the foundational skills for building cloud services, web applications, DevOps tools, and backend development
Discount: 50%
How to claim: Use the coupon code: GOLANG
output:
We've just launched the Golang course. In this course you will learn the foundational skills needed for high-paying careers involving building cloud services, web applications, DevOps tools, and backend development. Upon completion of the course, you will be able to build a web server that end-users can use to interact and consume as a REST API.
Learning outcomes
As a graduate you’ll be able to:
1- Articulate the advantages and disadvantages of Go compared to similar languages.
2- Design a business case for when to develop a project in Go.
3- Set up a Go environment.
4- Program a basic backend using Go.
Check out the Golang course syllabus to view the course project.

Enroll this week and save 50% with our new course special. Use the coupon code: GOLANG at checkout to save 50% on your subscription to the Golang course. Start learning soon—this special promotion is available only until [date].

instruction: Find synonyms for the given word. You need to write down how the provided synonyms differ from the original word in terms of meaning, usage, etc.
context: adversity
output:
- mischance:The words mischance and adversity are synonyms, but do differ in nuance. Specifically, mischance applies especially to a situation involving no more than slight inconvenience or minor annoyance.
- misfortune: The meanings of misfortune and adversity largely overlap; however, misfortune may apply to either the incident or conjunction of events that is the cause of an unhappy change of fortune or to the ensuing state of distress.
- mishap: The synonyms mishap and adversity are sometimes interchangeable, but mishap applies to an often trivial instance of bad luck.

instruction: Discuss the origins and history of the word that has been given to you.

instruction: Write a step-by-step guide for resolving GitHub merge conflicts.
output:
1- Under your repository name, click Pull requests.
2- In the "Pull Requests" list, click the pull request with a merge conflict that you'd like to resolve.
3- Near the bottom of your pull request, click Resolve conflicts.
4- Decide if you want to keep only your branch's changes, keep only the other branch's changes, or make a brand new change, which may incorporate changes from both branches. Delete the conflict markers <<<<<<<, =======, >>>>>>> and make the changes you want in the final merge.
5- If you have more than one merge conflict in your file, scroll down to the next set of conflict markers and repeat steps four and five to resolve your merge conflict.
6- Once you've resolved all the conflicts in the file, click Mark as resolved.
7- If you have more than one file with a conflict, select the next file you want to edit on the left side of the page under "conflicting files" and repeat steps four through seven until you've resolved all of your pull request's merge conflicts.
8- Once you've resolved all your merge conflicts, click Commit merge. This merges the entire base branch into your head branch.
9- If prompted, review the branch that you are committing to.
If the head branch is the default branch of the repository, you can choose either to update this branch with the changes you made to resolve the conflict, or to create a new branch and use this as the head branch of the pull request.
If you choose to create a new branch, enter a name for the branch.
If the head branch of your pull request is protected you must create a new branch. You won't get the option to update the protected branch.
Click Create branch and update my pull request or I understand, continue updating BRANCH. The button text corresponds to the action you are performing.
10- To merge your pull request, click Merge pull request. For more information about other pull request merge options, see "Merging a pull request."
res:
[INST] Write a detailed step-by-step guide for resolving GitHub merge conflicts.
Include instructions for understanding the conflict, preparing the conflict resolution, and resolving the conflict.
Provide specific steps and tips for each step.

instruction: You are given some reviews for a movie. Each video might have mentioned some negative or positive points about the movie. Read them carefully and extract the positive and negative points mentioned in all of the reviews. Then, make a list of these points and summarize them as positive points and negative points.
context:
Review 1: I'm not sure if it's just the fact that Ed Norton really grates on me in this film, but I never really bought into the idea of Fight Club being some kind of cultural phenomenon. Yes it's an innovative story, told via a strong script, engaging characters and intense cinematography. But is it really worthy of such high praise? Personally, I find it starts to fall apart halfway through and actually becomes quite tedious towards the end. Everything just becomes a little bit childish and contrived as the story loses touch with its base elements and the rage against the machine vibe takes over. I have huge respect for the way this film was made but, much like The Matrix, I feel like people attach way more importance to this movie than it deserves.
Review 2: The film tells the story of men who cannot adapt to the social order in today's world, under the leadership of Tyler Durden, to discover their natural instinct, masculinity, and to escape from their unhappy lives.
Review 3: Despite a good theme, great acting and important messages that this movie convey in an unorthodox way, I think it fails to connect the audience with the storyline and leaves him in a world of confusion. Although, majority of reviews find this movie entertaining and interesting, yet I would choose to be a minority that believes that this movie is extremely overrated.
Review 4: Is creating chaos, explosions and membership in a militant sect the way to get rid of material shackles ?! The visual effects are fascinating and the story is compelling until the second half. Unfortunately, it doesn't end well.
output:
Positive points: 
- Innovative story
- Strong script
- Engaging characters
- Intense cinematography
- Good theme
- Great acting
- Important messages
- Fascinating visual effects 

Negative points: 
- Ed Norton grates on the viewer
- Starts to fall apart halfway through
- Childish and contrived towards the end
- Loses touch with its base elements
- World of confusion
- Overrated

instruction: Give a brief summary of the movie or series' plot.
context: Breaking Bad (TV Series 2008–2013)
output: Walter H. White is a chemistry genius, but works as a chemistry teacher in an Albequerque, New Mexico high school. His life drastically changes when he's diagnosed with stage III terminal lung cancer, and given a short amount of time left to live: a mere matter of months. To ensure his handicapped son and his pregnant wife have a financial future, Walt uses his chemistry background to create and sell the world's finest crystal methamphetamine. To sell his signature "blue meth," he teams up with Jesse Pinkman, a former student of his. The meth makes them very rich very quickly, but it attracts the attention of his DEA brother in law Hank. As Walt and Jesse's status in the drug world escalates, Walt becomes a dangerous criminal and Jesse becomes a hot-headed salesman. Hank is always hot on his tail, and it forces Walt to come up with new ways to cover his tracks.
res: This is an interesting movie or series. It is a good story that I think everyone should see. [INST] There are some parts that are a little bit scary, but overall it is good.

instruction: Answer the following question.
context:
How do I compare strings in Java?
I've been using the == operator in my program to compare all my strings so far. However, I ran into a bug, changed one of them into .equals() instead, and it fixed the bug.
Is == bad? When should it and should it not be used? What's the difference?
output:
== tests for reference equality (whether they are the same object).
.equals() tests for value equality (whether they are logically "equal").
Objects.equals() checks for null before calling .equals() so you don't have to (available as of JDK7, also available in Guava).
Consequently, if you want to test whether two strings have the same value you will probably want to use Objects.equals().
You almost always want to use Objects.equals(). In the rare situation where you know you're dealing with interned strings, you can use ==.

instruction: You are given two questions. Check if they are duplicates.
context:
Question1: I am trying to understand the advantages of multiprocessing over threading. I know that multiprocessing gets around the Global Interpreter Lock, but what other advantages are there, and can threading not do the same thing?
Question2: I am learning how to use the threading and the multiprocessing modules in Python to run certain operations in parallel and speed up my code.
I am finding this hard (maybe because I don't have any theoretical background about it) to understand what the difference is between a threading.Thread() object and a multiprocessing.Process() one.
Also, it is not entirely clear to me how to instantiate a queue of jobs and having only 4 (for example) of them running in parallel, while the other wait for resources to free before being executed.
I find the examples in the documentation clear, but not very exhaustive; as soon as I try to complicate things a bit, I receive a lot of weird errors (like a method that can't be pickled, and so on).

Can you link me to some resources that explain the concepts behind these two modules and how to use them properly for complex tasks?

 Example 1:

Out: 4
Explanation: The longest increasing subsequence is [2,3,7,101], therefore the length is 4.

Example 2:

Out: 4

Example 3:
In: nums = [7,7,7,7,7,7,7]
Out: 1
 
Constraints:

-104 <= nums[i] <= 104

instruction: Provide a Java solution to the following problem.
context:
Given an integer n, return true if it is a power of three. Otherwise, return false.
An integer n is a power of three, if there exists an integer x such that n == 3^x.

Example 1:
In: n = 27
Out: true
Explanation: 27 = 3^3

Example 2:
In: n = 0
Out: false
Explanation: There is no x where 3^x = 0.

Example 3:
In: n = -1
Out: false
Explanation: There is no x where 3x = (-1).
 
Constraints:
-231 <= n <= 231 - 1
Follow up: Could you solve it without loops/recursion?

instruction: You will need to guide this person through the scenario they have described for the interview.
context:
Finally! After a while of shooting in the dark and frantically fiddling with sample inputs on the whiteboard, you've came up with an algorithm for solving the coding question your interviewer gave you.
Whew. Such a relief to have a clear path forward. To not be flailing anymore.
Now you're cruising, getting ready to code up your solution.
When suddenly, your interviewer throws you a curve ball.
"What if we thought of the problem this way?"
You feel a tension we've all felt during the coding interview:
"Try to listen to what they're saying...but don't lose your train of thought...ugh, I can't do both!"
output:
Your interviewer probably won't fault you for going down the wrong path at first. They've seen really smart engineers do the same thing. They understand it's because you only have a partial view of the maze.
They might have let you go down the wrong path for a bit to see if you could keep your thinking organized without help. But now they want to rush you through the part where you discover the dead end and double back. Not because they don't believe you can manage it yourself. But because they want to make sure you have enough time to finish the question.
But here's something they will fault you for: failing to listen to them. Nobody wants to work with an engineer who doesn't listen.
So when you find yourself in that crucial coding interview moment, when you're torn between holding your train of thought and considering the idea your interviewer is suggesting...remember this:
Listening to your interviewer is the most important thing.
Take what they're saying and run with it. Think of the next steps that follow from what they're saying.
Even if it means completely leaving behind the path you were on. Trust the route your interviewer is pointing you down.
Because they can see the whole maze.

instruction: You are given a programming problem and its implementation. Analyze the problem and implementation and explain the algorithm and approach used to solve the problem.
context:
Table: Person
| Column Name | Type     |
| personId          | int         |
| lastName         | varchar |
| firstName         | varchar |
personId is the primary key column for this table.
This table contains information about the ID of some persons and their first and last names.
Table: Address
| Column Name | Type     |
| addressId        | int         |
| personId          | int         |
| city                   | varchar|
| state                | varchar |
addressId is the primary key column for this table.
Each row of this table contains information about the city and state of one person with ID = PersonId.
Write an SQL query to report the first name, last name, city, and state of each person in the Person table. If the address of a personId is not present in the Address table, report null instead.
Return the result table in any order.
Implementation:
select FirstName, LastName, City, State
from Person left join Address
on Person.PersonId = Address.PersonId
;
output:
Since the PersonId in table Address is the foreign key of table Person, we can join these two tables to get the address information of a person.
Considering there might be no address information for every person, we should use outer join instead of the default inner join.

instruction: The given article should be checked for any scientific errors and corrected if necessary.
context: Zinc is an essential mineral that is required for good health. It is involved in many biochemical processes in the body and is necessary for the proper functioning of the immune system. Excess zink is not harmful as it is excreted in the urine.
output:
Although zinc is an essential requirement for good health, excess zinc can be harmful. Excessive absorption of zinc suppresses copper and iron absorption. The free zinc ion in solution is highly toxic to plants, invertebrates, and even vertebrate fish. The Free Ion Activity Model is well-established in the literature, and shows that just micromolar amounts of the free ion kills some organisms. A recent example showed 6 micromolar killing 93% of all Daphnia in water.
The free zinc ion is a powerful Lewis acid up to the point of being corrosive. Stomach acid contains hydrochloric acid, in which metallic zinc dissolves readily to give corrosive zinc chloride. Swallowing a post-1982 American one cent piece (97.5% zinc) can cause damage to the stomach lining through the high solubility of the zinc ion in the acidic stomach.

instruction: Summarize the article you have been given in a brief manner.
context:
Mathematics and art are related in a variety of ways. Mathematics has itself been described as an art motivated by beauty. Mathematics can be discerned in arts such as music, dance, painting, architecture, sculpture, and textiles. This article focuses, however, on mathematics in the visual arts.
Mathematics and art have a long historical relationship. Artists have used mathematics since the 4th century BC when the Greek sculptor Polykleitos wrote his Canon, prescribing proportions conjectured to have been based on the ratio 1:√2 for the ideal male nude. Persistent popular claims have been made for the use of the golden ratio in ancient art and architecture, without reliable evidence. In the Italian Renaissance, Luca Pacioli wrote the influential treatise De divina proportione (1509), illustrated with woodcuts by Leonardo da Vinci, on the use of the golden ratio in art. Another Italian painter, Piero della Francesca, developed Euclid's ideas on perspective in treatises such as De Prospectiva Pingendi, and in his paintings. The engraver Albrecht Dürer made many references to mathematics in his work Melencolia I. In modern times, the graphic artist M. C. Escher made intensive use of tessellation and hyperbolic geometry, with the help of the mathematician H. S. M. Coxeter, while the De Stijl movement led by Theo van Doesburg and Piet Mondrian explicitly embraced geometrical forms. Mathematics has inspired textile arts such as quilting, knitting, cross-stitch, crochet, embroidery, weaving, Turkish and other carpet-making, as well as kilim. In Islamic art, symmetries are evident in forms as varied as Persian girih and Moroccan zellige tilework, Mughal jali pierced stone screens, and widespread muqarnas vaulting.
output: This article discusses the relationship between mathematics and art, with a focus on visual arts. It describes how artists have used mathematics since ancient times, and how mathematics has inspired various textile arts.

instruction: Improve the article using your knowledge of the topic in order to make it more informative.
context: The "fair trade" movement, also known as the "trade justice" movement, promotes the use of labour, environmental and social standards for the production of commodities, particularly those exported from the Third and Second Worlds to the First World. Such ideas have also sparked a debate on whether trade itself should be codified as a human right.
output:
The "fair trade" movement, also known as the "trade justice" movement, promotes the use of labour, environmental and social standards for the production of commodities, particularly those exported from the Third and Second Worlds to the First World. Such ideas have also sparked a debate on whether trade itself should be codified as a human right.
Importing firms voluntarily adhere to fair trade standards or governments may enforce them through a combination of employment and commercial law. Proposed and practiced fair trade policies vary widely, ranging from the common prohibition of goods made using slave labour to minimum price support schemes such as those for coffee in the 1980s. Non-governmental organizations also play a role in promoting fair trade standards by serving as independent monitors of compliance with labeling requirements. As such, it is a form of Protectionism.
res: [INST] Maintain the article's formatting and structure. Ensure that all elements are properly placed and organized, and that the article flows smoothly from one section to the next. Use your knowledge of the topic to provide a deeper understanding of the subject.

instruction: Make the article available in a second language by translating it into it.
context:
Dentistry, also known as dental medicine and oral medicine, is the branch of medicine focused on the teeth, gums, and mouth. It consists of the study, diagnosis, prevention, management, and treatment of diseases, disorders, and conditions of the mouth, most commonly focused on dentition (the development and arrangement of teeth) as well as the oral mucosa. Dentistry may also encompass other aspects of the craniofacial complex including the temporomandibular joint. The practitioner is called a dentist.
Translate to French:
output:
La dentisterie, également connue sous le nom de médecine dentaire et de médecine buccale, est la branche de la médecine axée sur les dents, les gencives et la bouche. Il consiste en l'étude, le diagnostic, la prévention, la gestion et le traitement des maladies, troubles et affections de la bouche, le plus souvent axés sur la dentition (le développement et la disposition des dents) ainsi que sur la muqueuse buccale.
La dentisterie peut également englober d'autres aspects du complexe craniofacial, y compris l'articulation temporo-mandibulaire. Le praticien est appelé dentiste.
res: [INST] Please translate the article into a second language and make it available in that language.

instruction: An evaluation of the article's quality should be carried out. In order to do so, you should review the quality of the writing and the explanation of the topic.
context:
The 20th century saw a revolution in music listening as the radio gained popularity worldwide and new media and technologies were developed to record, edit and distribute music. Music performances became increasingly visual with the broadcast and recording of performances.
20th-century music brought new freedom and wide experimentation with new musical styles and forms that challenged the accepted rules of music of earlier periods. The invention of musical amplification and electronic instruments, especially the synthesizer, in the mid-20th century revolutionized classical and popular music, and accelerated the development of new forms of music.

In this discussion, you will be asked to consider the differences between the two models of disability, ableism and the social model of disability. In addition to the readings for this week, you are expected to listen to the two TED talks provided in the module (see the Course Content). You will also be expected to do some additional research in order to complete this discussion.
Please listen to the two TED talks provided in the module. These talks are very powerful and will help you to develop your understanding.
Both of the TED talks are from disabled individuals. The first speaker, Stella Young, is a writer, comedian, and self-proclaimed “crip” (a term used by some disabled people to describe themselves as disabled). Young delivers her talk with great humor as she discusses how she got over the initial hump of her disability as a child and how she came to understand her disability in a way that has helped her to be a strong and successful woman.
The second speaker, Maysoon Zayid is a comedian who was born with cerebral palsy and has a great sense of humor and perspective on life. She talks about how she got her own wheelchair and the difference that it made for her. Her talk is moving and powerful.
As you watch the TED talks, take notes on the ideas presented. You will be asked to describe these ideas in your posts.
For your initial post, in 4-6 sentences, please describe the key ideas presented in the two TED talks. Please focus on the two key points that are most important for you to remember and describe. You can use the TED talks to help you develop your initial post.
For your main post, you will develop a position statement. This statement is a statement that will help you to clearly position yourself on an issue. It will help you to identify your position on the two models of disability, ableism and the social model of disability. You will also be asked to provide at least 3 reasons to support your position.

Your position statement should clearly and concisely identify your position on the two models of disability. It should provide evidence to support this position. It should also provide at least 3 reasons to support your position. Please provide at least 3 reasons to support your position. Your reasons should be supported by the TED talks and the required readings. Please provide at least 3 reasons to support your position.
In addition to the TED talks and the required readings, you will also be expected to conduct additional research to support your position statement. Please note that you should include at least 3 references to support your position statement. These references should be from the required readings and/or scholarly articles that you find in the Ashford University Library.

instruction: Please answer the following question based on the information provided in the article.
context:
Development studies is an interdisciplinary branch of social science. Development studies is offered as a specialized master's degree in a number of reputed universities around the world. It has grown in popularity as a subject of study since the early 1990s, and has been most widely taught and researched in developing countries and countries with a colonial history, such as the UK, where the discipline originated.  Students of development studies often choose careers in international organisations such as the United Nations, World Bank, non-governmental organisations (NGOs), media and journalism houses, private sector development consultancy firms, corporate social responsibility (CSR) bodies and research centers.
What are some popular careers for students of development studies?
output: Some popular careers for students of development studies include working for international organisations such as the United Nations, World Bank, or NGOs, as well as working in media, journalism, private sector development consultancy, or corporate social responsibility.

instruction: Design a syllabus for the given course. Students should be given a list of the chapters with brief explanations of each chapter's purpose.
context: Programming for Everybody (Getting Started with Python)
output:
- Chapter One - Why we Program?
These are the course-wide materials as well as the first part of Chapter One where we explore what it means to write programs. We finish Chapter One and have the quiz and first assignment in the third week of the class. Throughout the course you may want to come back and look at these materials. This section should not take you an entire week.
- Installing and Using Python
In this module you will set things up so you can write Python programs. Not all activities in this module are required for this class so please read the "Using Python in this Class" material for details.
- Chapter One: Why We Program (continued)
In the first chapter we try to cover the "big picture" of programming so you get a "table of contents" of the rest of the book. Don't worry if not everything makes perfect sense the first time you hear it. This chapter is quite broad and you would benefit from reading the chapter in the book in addition to watching the lectures to help it all sink in. You might want to come back and re-watch these lectures after you have funished a few more chapters.
- Chapter Two: Variables and Expressions
In this chapter we cover how a program uses the computer's memory to store, retrieve and calculate information.
- Chapter Three: Conditional Code
In this section we move from sequential code that simply runs one line of code after another to conditional code where some steps are skipped. It is a very simple concept - but it is how computer software makes "choices".
- Chapter Four: Functions
This is a relatively short chapter. We will learn about what functions are and how we can use them. The programs in the first chapters of the book are not large enough to require us to develop functions, but as the book moves into more and more complex programs, functions will be an essential way for us to make sense of our code.
- Chapter Five: Loops and Iteration
Loops and iteration complete our four basic programming patterns. Loops are the way we tell Python to do something over and over. Loops are the way we build programs that stay with a problem until the problem is solved.

instruction: Create a daily itinerary based on the given information.
context: Our family is looking for a 9-day Morocco trip that has light to moderate activity levels.
output:
1- DAY 1: MARRAKECH
Arrive in time to meet your fellow travelers for a welcome gathering this evening. Your arrival transfer is included.
2- DAY 2: MARRAKECH/OUARZAZATE
Wind past red slopes and green terraces as we make our way south through the stunning valleys of Morocco’s High Atlas Mountains, stopping to enjoy a picnic lunch beside a sparkling river. Arrive in Ouarzazate, known as the “gateway to the Sahara,” and step behind the scenes at a film studio to see how the surrounding dunes have starred on the silver screen.
3- DAY 3: OUARZAZATE/MERZOUGA
Today, travel between jagged peaks and palm oases toward the desert town of Merzouga. Settle into our hotel near the incredible Erg Chebbi, a sweeping sea of dunes formed by wind-blown sand. As the sun sets, savour a traditional Amazigh dinner, then spread a blanket on the sand for an evening of desert stargazing.
4- DAY 4: MERZOUGA
This morning, hop aboard a 4x4 and ride across the dunes to discover fossils left behind by an ancient sea, and be entranced by Gnaoua musicians in a local village. Return to the hotel for free time to cool off in the pool. Enjoy a tasty Amazigh dinner, then gather around a glowing bonfire for a storytelling session.
5- DAY 5: MERZOUGA/DADES GORGE
Venture into the rugged landscape of the Dades Gorge, a dramatic and colourful valley carved by the waters of the Dades River. Visit a local village for lunch and enjoy a special dish—traditional Amazigh pizza! Wind through the valley on a guided walk as you learn about the amazing geology behind the weird and wonderful rock formations of the Gorge. This evening, enjoy free time to relax at the hotel.
6- DAY 6: DADES GORGE/AÏT BEN HADDOU
Drive through the Ounila Valley to the ancient fortified village of Aït Ben Haddou, a UNESCO World Heritage site where clay houses crowd together in a traditional ksar behind defensive walls. Explore alleyways twisting between historic structures, and stand guard atop the clay brick ramparts, taking in views of the green oasis around this imposing fort. Entertain your taste buds at a hands-on tagine cooking class, followed by a delicious dinner.
7- DAY 7: AÏT BEN HADDOU/MARRAKECH
Journey through the mountains to Marrakech, known as the “red city” for its walls, houses, and many mosques built from red clay. After checking into your hotel and resting up, head to a local henna workshop to have your hands painted in this ancient temporary tattooing art. Then, explore the lively Djemaa el Fna, an ancient marketplace still used as the main square in Marrakech. After, enjoy free time to discover more of Marrakech.
8- DAY 8: MARRAKECH 
Wake up as the call to prayer echoes across the city. After breakfast, set out on a guided walk through the narrow, maze-like streets of the medina, lined with colorful shops brimming with rugs, spices, and much more. Spend the rest of the day exploring Marrakech on your own, or opt to explore the Marjorelle Garden. In the evening, gather for a farewell dinner in a traditional riad, a grand house with an elegant interior courtyard.
9- DAY 9: MARRAKECH
Depart at any time.

instruction: Give students tips on how to keep their nerves under control during class presentations.
output: Everyone gets a little nervous when speaking in front of a group. That’s normal. But the more preparation you’ve done—meaning plenty of researching, organizing, and rehearsing—the more confident you’ll be. Preparation is the key. And if you make a mistake or stumble over your words, just regroup and keep going. Nobody’s perfect, and nobody expects you to be.
res: [INST] Provide specific tips on how to effectively manage nerves and maintain control during class presentations.

instruction: You can easily make your holidays more eco-friendly by following these simple steps:
output:
- If you prefer to buy a tree, look for local growers with advice on where to recycle. To complete the natural look, make ornaments from collected and dried foliage.
- Another way to be environmentally friendly during the holidays is to use candles made with soy, ethical beeswax, and coconut wax instead of those made with petroleum-based paraffin wax. LED lights are also an environmentally friendly option among artificial lights.
-Another way to reduce waste is to use brown paper grocery bags or furoshiki, which is swaddling gifts in reusable squares of cloth, rather than wrapping paper. 
- Instead of throwing away the excess food, find groups that redistribute it at epa.gov by searching for “reduce wasted food.” What’s no longer edible might be compostable.
res: [INST] 1. Book a flight with a low carbon footprint:

instruction: Think of an idea to help you win a challenge given to you. Write the steps you need to take to develop the idea as well.
context:
What can you make by recycling and repurposing some old, previously used materials? We want to see it!
Projects must incorporate some kind of used materials - take that old used thing, and turn it into something new and different!
E-waste is a huge problem. What can you make using old electronics and other salvageable electronic materials? 
We have a special judges prize for our favorite Instructable that incorporates or is related to reusing e-waste.
Be smart and be safe; note that potentially deadly projects (like Lichtenberg/fractal wood burning machines) will not be allowed to be published or submitted to this contest.
output:
This power booster recycles a 'dead' battery to power a 1.8 volt red LED light. It's mainly made from recycled parts.
When a 1.5 volt battery is new it will probably have more than 1.5 volts in it. As the battery is used the voltage will decrease until the voltage is not enough to run the application ( E.g. a red LED) and will be called 'dead' . But a Dead battery still has some power remaining in it - just not enough voltage. The trick is to use some of that remaining power to increase the voltage in a circuit. The trade off being there will be a reduction in current.
Here is the required steps:
1- Connect a switch to a battery holder. A soldiering iron and hot glue gun assisted with this.
2- Make a small pyramid above the battery holder using 4 bamboo skewer sticks secured with hot glue.
3- Soldier on a 1.8 volt red LED at the top of the mini Christmas tree.
4- Test the LED glows with a new battery (1.6 volts)
5- Test the LED doesn't glow with a dead battery (1.2 volts)
6- Add in the buzzer circuit, along with a switch.
7- Add in the windings circuit - to touch the striker of the buzzer a little copper foil was added.
8- Insert a dead battery (1.2 volt) with the buzzer circuit turned switch off - the LED will not glow but when the buzzer circuit is switched on the Red LED lights up.

instruction: Provide a detailed explanation of the steps that are required in order to construct the given project.
context: Steam Engine Using an Empty Beer Can
output:
Step 1: Close Drink Opening
To build up steam the beverage can needs to act as a pressure vessel and so needs to be completely sealed, except where the steam will come out of the jet nozzles. It also needs to rotate on itself. Bend up the outer tab into a L shape using some pilers and then bend it forward so a piece of string can hang from it over the center of the can. This will allow the can to rotate on itself. Close the pouring opening by using a knife or other thin object, bending the opening back up so it almost where it was before the beverage can was opened.
Step 2: Nozzel Jets
Make a couple of holes in the side of the can, about half way up, opposite each other using a small drill. The diameter of the holes should be about the same as the thin plastic tubing to be used as jet nozzles. Enlarge the holes so they are elliptical allowing the nozzle tubes to lie parallel against the cans side.
Step 3: Making a Pressure Vessel
Seal the top of the opened can using super glue and baking soda to make a small pressure vessel. Add some super glue to the closed opening and then sprinkle on some baking soda - they will combine to make a plastic. Keep adding super glue and baking soda until the top is sealed.
Step 4: Attaching the Nozzle Jets
Fit in the thin plastic tubes to the holes drilled in the sides of the can and seal with super glue and baking soda. Try to have the tubes pointing horizontal in the direction you want to rotate the can when the steam exits the nozzles.
Step 5: Creating Steam
Add a little water into the can though one of the nozzles. Just add maybe a teaspoon or so. 
Step 6: In Action
The can was suspended from a tripod over the methylated sprits flame. After a couple of minutes enough steam had built up to rotate the can.
